Learn how to manage UI settings and data: Learn how to manage UI settings and data configurations with the UI Setting module.
The UI Setting package provides a flexib: The UI Setting package provides a flexible framework for managing dynamic application settings without code changes. It enables administrators to define custom fields and users to store data conforming to those schemas.
Use this package when you need to:: Use this package when you need to:
Allow admins to define custom forms with: Allow admins to define custom forms without developer intervention
Create user-editable notification or ema: Create user-editable notification or email template settings
Build configurable dropdown lists or mas: Build configurable dropdown lists or master data tables
Every new setting requires code deployme: Every new setting requires code deployment
Field definitions enforce data types and: Field definitions enforce data types and constraints
Hard to build admin UI for settings: Hard to build admin UI for settings
The module operates with two main compon: The module operates with two main components:
Define the schema/structure for data ent: Define the schema/structure for data entries. Each setting has a code, name, and a list of fields that describe the data structure.
Actual data entries that conform to a se: Actual data entries that conform to a setting's schema. Each data setting belongs to a specific setting code.
Enable the settings REST API controller: Enable the settings REST API controller
Enable the data settings REST API contro: Enable the data settings REST API controller
Each field in a setting can have the fol: Each field in a setting can have the following properties:
Whether to display in list views: Whether to display in list views
The `DataSettingService` manages data en: The `DataSettingService` manages data entries for defined settings.
When controllers are enabled, the follow: When controllers are enabled, the following endpoints are available:
The module automatically handles multi-t: The module automatically handles multi-tenant data isolation. Each tenant's settings and data are stored with tenant-specific keys:
Scenario: Each user can configure their: Scenario: Each user can configure their notification preferences (email on/off, SMS on/off).
Implementation: Create a \"notification-: Implementation: Create a "notification-settings" schema, then store each user's preferences as data entries.
